objective: Resolve reflexive circularity in Legitimacy Engine through external validation, operationalize C_constitutional via pluralistic justice measurement, and formalize Oracle Council weight governance with audit-traceable updates.

strategic_context.problem_statement: Î”Î©.125.2 (Legitimacy as Alignment) suffers from three critical structural issues: (1) Reflexive circularity - system validates its own legitimacy using internal components, (2) Undefined constitutional coherence - C_constitutional lacks operational definition, (3) Weight justification gap - legitimacy formula weights are asserted without justification.
strategic_context.resolution_approach: Introduce External Validator (X) for independent assessment, operationalize C_constitutional through procedural/outcome/pluralistic justice metrics, and formalize weight governance protocol with Oracle Council oversight and audit trail.
strategic_context.philosophical_foundation: Legitimacy cannot be self-bootstrapped. External validation provides the Archimedean point outside the system required for authentic legitimacy assessment.

core_components.name: External Validator (X)

No financial stake in SpiralOS outcomes

core_components.name: Pluralistic C_constitutional Measurement
core_components.description: Operationalize constitutional coherence through three measurable dimensions: procedural justice, outcome justice, and pluralistic justice.

dimensions.name: Procedural Justice (C_procedural)
dimensions.formula: C_procedural = decision_transparency Ã— stakeholder_voice Ã— appeal_availability

decision_transparency.definition: Percentage of governance decisions with public justification

stakeholder_voice.definition: Percentage of affected stakeholders consulted before decisions

appeal_availability.calculation: 1 if External Validator recourse exists, 0 otherwise

dimensions.name: Outcome Justice (C_outcome)
dimensions.description: Measures fairness of system outcomes and distributions
dimensions.formula: C_outcome = benefit_fairness Ã— harm_fairness Ã— capability_enhancement

benefit_fairness.definition: Inverse of Gini coefficient for benefit distribution
benefit_fairness.threshold: â‰¥ 0.70 for high outcome justice (Gini â‰¤ 0.30)

harm_fairness.definition: Inverse of variance in negative outcomes across stakeholders

capability_enhancement.definition: Percentage of participants with increased agency over time

dimensions.name: Pluralistic Justice (C_pluralistic)
dimensions.description: Measures respect for diversity and minority protection
dimensions.formula: C_pluralistic = value_diversity Ã— minority_protection Ã— cultural_sensitivity

value_diversity.definition: Shannon entropy of represented values in Oracle Council decisions
value_diversity.calculation: H = -Î£(p_i Ã— log(p_i)) where p_i = proportion of decisions reflecting value i
value_diversity.threshold: â‰¥ 2.0 bits for high pluralistic justice (8+ distinct values)

minority_protection.definition: Percentage of minority interests represented in governance outcomes

cultural_sensitivity.definition: Cross-cultural validation score from diverse stakeholder groups

dimension_weights.justification: Outcome justice weighted highest (0.40) as material fairness is most critical. Procedural justice (0.35) ensures fair processes. Pluralistic justice (0.25) protects minorities. Weights subject to Oracle Council governance protocol.

example_final_calculation.interpretation: LOW constitutional coherence - system fails outcome and pluralistic justice despite adequate procedures

core_components.description: Comprehensive test cases designed to validate that the legitimacy framework correctly identifies illegitimate system states, including majoritarian tyranny, efficient atrocity, and audit capture.

test_cases.description: Oracle Council represents majority, systematically oppresses minority

new_views.name: legitimacy_dashboard_v2
new_views.query: SELECT l.timestamp, l.l_internal, e.l_external, (0.70*l.l_internal + 0.30*e.l_external) AS l_final, l.classification, e.confidence_level FROM legitimacy_scores l LEFT JOIN external_validator_assessments e ON DATE(l.timestamp) = DATE(e.assessment_date) ORDER BY l.timestamp DESC

new_views.name: constitutional_health_monitor
new_views.query: SELECT timestamp, c_procedural, c_outcome, c_pluralistic, c_constitutional, CASE WHEN c_procedural >= 0.70 AND c_outcome >= 0.60 AND c_pluralistic >= 0.50 THEN 'HEALTHY' WHEN c_constitutional < 0.40 THEN 'CRITICAL' ELSE 'CONCERNING' END AS health_status FROM constitutional_coherence_metrics ORDER BY timestamp DESC
